descriptive_hints: In column 3, the clue [10] means every cell in that column is filled, so you can mark them all.
Since column 4 also has a [10] clue, you can fill every cell in that column as well.
In column 5, with the clue [10], fill all cells, solidifying three entire columns.
The middle columns (3-5) are completely filled, providing a solid base for filling other areas.
In the left columns (1-2), the [2, 2] clues indicate four filled cells on each column, with gaps at the beginning and end.
The top row has a clue of [3], indicating three filled cells, which aligns with the left part of the grid.
The third row's clue of [8] suggests that all rows except the last two have filled cells in this row.
The fifth row clue [2, 3] aligns with the filled patterns on the left and most right of the puzzle.
The eighth row clue [2, 5] matches with the filled pattern in columns 1 through 5.
The left quadrants reveal a mirrored pattern between the top and bottom halves, with two gaps on either end.
The [6] clue in the second row shows a clear pattern starting from the left, extending to the middle columns.
meaning_hints: Puzzle meaning riddle: 'I help you get to places fast and comfortably. What am I?'
Puzzle meaning riddle: 'I have four wheels, but I'm not a cart. I run on roads and take you from start to finish. What am I?'
Puzzle meaning riddle: 'I have an engine but I'm not a plane. I need fuel to keep moving but I'm not a rocket. What am I?'
